utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Richard, it pains me to admit it, but I am in your debt.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Deeply. But if you’d like to start paying rent –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no. I mean, I owe you a debt of gratitude.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: If you had not urged me to take this audition I would have never gotten this part. Now, I am off to my wardrobe fitting. ‘Bye!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And where are you off to?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, I signed up for an escort service. I have to meet a client.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? A what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I just wanted to see if you were listening. I’m going to the library to study.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not cool.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Bye Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Bye bud.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A goodbye kiss? When did that start?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just now. Yeah, no, I’m as surprised as you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know if I’m surprised. I mean, you are pretty lovable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you raised a great person, so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm, you say that now. You weren’t here for the beginning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And next time I will be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Next time? Are you saying that you’re … thinking about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. About it. About my job. About we’re whether we’re ready. If there’s ever a right time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There never is. But there’s never a wrong time, either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except maybe now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. We’ll talk about it later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who found the body?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Homeless guy. Ed Turner. Said he found her in this recycling bin when he was scavenging for bottles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We get Turner’s statement?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, we haven’t found him yet. He called 911 from a nearby payphone but when we got here he was already gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Obviously she’s not carrying ID. So uh, I’m guessing we don’t know who she is?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Hopefully we will in a minute. In the meantime I can give you a pretty good idea of how she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Manual strangulation.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Probably 24 to 36 hours ago. Based on lividity she was put in the dumpster right after she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Abrasions on her feet, mud spatter on her legs … she was running. Someone was chasing her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And then caught her, killed her, and stuffed her in that dumpster over there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And she’s wearing a nightgown. She couldn’t have come from very far.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll have unis show her photo around. Try to find someone who recognizes her. Canvass. See if there are any witnesses who might have seen what happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s just … something about her. Something familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What, like you know her?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, I definitely don’t know her. If she’s in the system we can find out who she is.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Susan Watts. Born in Vestal, New York. High school dropout. Multiple arrests: check kiting, petty larceny, bust for possession. The last one got her sent to Albion, but she was released six months ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything since then?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, that was her last known contact with law enforcement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about known associates? Maybe she was hanging out with someone who knows who killed her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No associates listed, but I do have Susan Watts’ address.

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, NYPD. I need to ask you a few questions about Susan Watts.

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: Why? Did something happen?

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: I quit smoking seven years ago and I really want a cigarette right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Katrina, when was the last time you saw Susan? Or talked to her?

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: Maybe three months ago? About the time she moved out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She moved out? Where’d she go?

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: I don’t know. She didn’t stay here long. Less than six months.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she have any friends? Boyfriends? People that she partied with?

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: Susan wasn’t like that. Not anymore. I posted an ad looking for a roommate and she answered. She was upfront that she used to be an addict. Been in prison. But she swore she was done with all that. She actually turned out to be the dream roommate. Go figure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why did she move out?

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: She got some great new job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a job?

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: I’m not sure. But all of a sudden she could afford great clothes and a way nicer place, so off she went. I was happy for her. It seemed like she’d really turned her life around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else can you tell me about this new job? Who did she work for?

utterance.speaker: KATRINA
utterance.content: She never told me. She was actually kind of secretive about it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So the canvass is coming up empty. There’s no sign of Ed Turner, the dude who called 911. No witnesses. And no one who knows Susan Watts. Which is weird, because why would she be running down that alley in her ‘jams if she didn’t live in the neighborhood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know what else is weird? I can’t find anything on this job that she had.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No W-2s or 1099s?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or social security withholdings, so she must have been paid in cash?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So maybe her job was illegal and that might be part of the reason she was killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The only reference I found regarding employment was a place called New Start Horizons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like a diet plan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you would think so. Um, but it’s a job placement organization for women who have been incarcerated, based right here in the city. Susan met with them when they visited the prison.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So maybe they placed her in that job and they might know where she moved to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, I’ll loop Beckett in on New Start Horizons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what’s up?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, for one thing, I found this in the victim’s hair.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A feather.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Probably from bedding. A down pillow or something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So maybe she was in bed, got chased out of her house. The killer could have been somebody she knew. Maybe a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What’s the story with this woman?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why do you ask?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Is it something like this? She was in trouble with the law, then she gets her act together, finds a great job, but damn if you can figure out what that job is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Do you remember Pam Hodges?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. How could I forget her? She looked just like you.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s how she was made to look. Pam Hodges had the same story, except she was a hooker in Tampa. Out of nowhere she gets herself straightened out, gets a great job, then gets killed. Strangled.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but not in the same way. Pam was strangled by wire, by Carl Matthews. But we put him away. So what does Pam Hodges have to do with Susan Watts?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I think they’re connected.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me? Hi. I’m Detective Beckett, NYPD. I need to speak with someone about one of your clients, Susan Watts.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Let me contact the director.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, hey. What’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m here with Javi, and I think I know why Susan Watts looked familiar. She had cosmetic surgery on her face. Way less extreme, but a lot like what Pam Hodges had done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pam Hodges?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s the same cheek implants. It’s the same technique. Kate, I think Susan Watts’ surgery was performed by the same doctor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Kelly Nieman?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Please, let me offer you one of my pens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Thank you. We’re just here to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Oh, can I just say, you have an amazing face, Detective.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I can’t prove it, but my gut says this is Nieman’s work. She was in on the murders of Pam Hodges and Daniel Santos, and you could never nail her for it. Maybe this time you can.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Kate, are you still there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lane, uh … it’s not just your gut. Kelly Nieman is a part of this and I’m looking right at her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, Kelly Nieman is mixed up in this? I thought she left the country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s back. But the director at New Start Horizons claims that Dr. Nieman never met Susan Watts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Susan is dead and Kelly is a major donor of New Start Horizons.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What can I do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just stay close to the phone. I’ll be in touch.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Kate, how sure are you take Kelly Nieman is connected with the Susan Watts case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A lot of things point to her, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: As it did with Pan Hodges and Daniel Santos, but no actual proof. At the time you felt that 3XK played a part in those murders. Do you think he played a part in this one, too?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t have any evidence of it yet, sir. And we haven’t found any actual proof that Jerry Tyson is still alive. It’s possible that Kelly Nieman is a serial killer in her own right. She’s as shrewd and as high functioning a sociopath as he ever was.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: If Dr. Nieman is involved in this murder, how can I make sure that she doesn’t slip through our fingers again?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could bring Castle in to consult on this case.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, Detective –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, he knows the Nieman case inside and out. He could be a huge asset.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, I am inclined to agree with you, but – - Mr. Castle works on this case only.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Don’t thank me yet. I still have to get the DA on board.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse me, Captain? We looked into Kelly Nieman. She has a surgical clinic in Costa Rica. But she also began seeing patients right here in the city six months ago, through a cosmetic surgery group.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Saint Simon’s Hospital. Eighth floor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pam Hodges was murdered. So was Daniel Santos. They only person that they have in common is you.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: What possible motive would I have for killing anyone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She volunteered as a prison doctor. Not only that, she treated Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s gotta be Tyson’s girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He taught her everything he knew.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got here too late. Nieman cleared out. She’s gone.

utterance.speaker: JERRY TYSON
utterance.content: You think you’ve got this all figured out, but you don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We meet again. Like the song says.

utterance.speaker: KELLY NIEMAN
utterance.content: Kate Beckett. Such lovely features. What skilled hands could do with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not interested in a consultation.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Neither am I. You do know your little theory that I played a role in those deaths damaged my practice. My reputation. But I can truly say that’s all in the past now and I bear you no malice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s a relief. What can you tell me about Susan Watts?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I’m not familiar with that name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was a client at New Start Horizons.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Many women are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you never met her there?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I donate to New Start Horizons, Detective. But it’s not where I spend my time and I don’t know Susan Watts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does this refresh your memory? She got a job that apparently doesn’t exist. She also had cosmetic surgery performed by you.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: You must be mistaken. I never forget a face. Especially if I cut it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I suppose you won’t mind if I take a look at your patient records, just to be sure.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Of course not. I just need to see a court order, signed by a judge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll get one.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Not based on casual suspicions, which is all you seem to have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be back.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: A parting gift? A facial rejuvenation kit. My own product line.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: You sure? You look a bit fatigued.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: ‘sup, Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kelly Nieman just denied knowing Susan Watts and I need proof that she’s lying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We haven’t found any yet, but so far nobody at New Start Horizons remembers seeing them together. And there’s no forensic evidence that ties Nieman to the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put a surveillance detail on her. And pull security video from Saint Simon’s Hospital. Maybe Susan visited Nieman here or came in for an appointment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll get right on it, but you’re talking about weeks of footage to comb through and that’s even if Saint Simon’s lets us have it. But I do have some good news for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The DA signed off on Castle working this case with us. He’ll be here ready to jump in by the time you get back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really think Nieman’s behind Susan Watts’ murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Couldn’t tell. She’s got ice water in her veins. Although I’ll bet Kelly Nieman wasn’t in the alleyway doing the dirty work. Last time she had an accomplice. A proxy. Someone who did the killing for her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So who’s the proxy this time?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys. We got something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The hospital won’t share security footage without a court order.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: But I was able to look at a street cam with a view of the hospital entrance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So we started rolling through it and in no time we ran across this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s carrying a Kelly Nieman gift bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s her. That’s definitely Susan Watts.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Except there’s a timeline problem. This footage is from yesterday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: After Susan Watts was already dead, so this can’t be her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not Susan Watts?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, then either by some insane coincidence Kelly Nieman has another patient who looks exactly like Susan Watts –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or Nieman surgically changed that woman to look like Susan Watts for some reason. Either way, we’ve got to figure out where this woman is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God. Look who’s driving. It’s 3XK.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jerry Tyson. He’s alive.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Listen up, people. This woman is in grave danger. She left Saint Simon’s hospital yesterday and we urgently need to find her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She is a patient of Dr. Kelly Nieman. Nieman is not cooperating, so canvass the hospital. Someone there has to know who she is.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And work this vehicle. We find the truck, we find the woman, along with a man she took a ride with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That man is Jerry Tyson, also known as 3XK. And I am sure that no one here is more familiar with him than Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, a dubious distinction. 3XK, the triple killer, so named because he kills his victims in groups of three. Blondes, like his latest victim, Susan Watts. The original 3XK killings were unsolved and stopped soon after they started. But then four years ago another victim showed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Triple Killer is back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The man that we’re looking for is Marcus Gates.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now we couldn’t prove that Marcus Gates was 3XK. But his cell mate, Jerry Tyson, agreed to help us put Gates away in exchange for early release. That turned out to be not such a good deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not Marcus Gates. It was him all along. He’s the real Triple Killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By the time we realized that Jerry Tyson was 3XK, it was too late. We got close again when Tyson used the gun he stole from Detective Ryan in a homicide. The he dropped out of sight. But not for long.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Richard Castle, you’re under arrest for the murder of Tessa Horton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did this. You killed Tessa.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: You killed Tessa. You will not last the night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s not dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You shot him. He’s dead. It’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wish I could say my doubts were unfounded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would someone kill clones of Esposito and Lanie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kelly Nieman is playing a much deeper game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are the 3XK files?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I didn’t check out any files.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not just Tyson’s files that are gone. Lab work, DNA, tissue samples of every 3XK victim were checked out. By Lanie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Only not the real Lanie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And now, at the time we weren’t certain that Tyson was behind it all. We didn’t even know if he was alive. But we do now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But we might have gotten lucky. It looks like Susan Watts escaped from Tyson, forcing him to kill her in the alley and leave her body there. Which means he got careless. He made mistakes. Let’s press our advantage and find this woman before he becomes his next victim.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: You look well, Mr. Castle. Though your epicanthal folds could use some tending. I thought you stopped working on cases.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For you I made an exception.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Please know I’m here as a courtesy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sure you are. Uh, who is this woman? And don’t say you don’t know her. She’s carrying your swag bag.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: That doesn’t prove she’s a patient.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you saying she’s not a patient?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I’m saying I can’t answer that. I’d be breaking confidentiality.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which you’d be free to do – even obliged to do – especially if a patient’s life is in danger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She took a ride with Jerry Tyson. It doesn’t get more dangerous than that.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Except Jerry Tyson is dead. Therefore that can’t be him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Then who is he? And where do we find him?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I really couldn’t say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know why you’re here. To see what we have.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: What you have is irrelevant to me. I’m innocent of any wrongdoing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you’re innocent then why won’t you give us this woman’s name? Especially when not giving it makes you look guilty?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any judge we take this to will see this man as Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We will be granted a court order for that patient’s name. So you can give it to me now or I’ll see you in an hour in your hospital with a dozen police officers. Your choice.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Her name is Amy Barrett.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Run that name. Go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you admit that Amy Barrett is a patient of yours. Where does she live?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: I’ll have my office send her contact information.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did she want surgery?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: She wanted to enhance her appearance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it’s just an amazing coincidence she ended up looking exactly like Susan Watts?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: As I’ve said before, I don’t know who that is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet they look identical. Whatever you’re up to, whatever Tyson is up to, we will stop it.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Jerry Tyson is dead. And I have a surgery scheduled.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The contact info that Kelly Nieman’s office sent us was out of date. Amy moved out of her place two months ago. Still trying to figure out where.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just like Susan Watts.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s not all she had in common. Amy Barrett grew up in Arizona, ran away at 16. She drifted around, multiple arrests.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does she have any connection to New Start Horizons?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not that I can tell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nieman’s creating his victims.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For Jerry Tyson. They’re like clones. They’re blonde and pretty, just like Tyson likes them. Nieman finds these poor women, lost souls that no one is going to miss, and she remakes them. She grooms them for 3XK.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We got the truck. Tory picked it up on another street cam. We got a license plate. The vehicle belongs to a guy named Michael Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got an address?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Four blocks from where Susan Watts was found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is definitely the place.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How do you think Michael Boudreau fits in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He may be Tyson’s accomplice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Michael Boudreau, NYPD! Open the door!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Freeze! NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me see your hands!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Step away from the window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jerry Tyson, you are under arrest.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What I wouldn’t give to be in that box with Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we arrested him. He’s going away. I’m good with that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but he didn’t take your gun and get someone killed with it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ryan.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Did you find any sign of Amy Barrett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet. But CSU’s pulling prints to see if she was here. They’re also checking bedding and pillows to see if it matches that feather that Lanie found in Susan Watts’ hair.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, what’s the story on Michael Boudreau?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, based on his pay stubs and some other stuff, he came from Iowa six months ago. Works in construction.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, where is he now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We don’t know. We also don’t know about his connection to Jerry Tyson, either.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right. Keep me posted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Ryan! Check it out. Found this under the bed. Look at the photo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Amy Barrett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I never thought this day would come. Not only can we prove Jerry Tyson is alive but we have him in custody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What we don’t have is a smoking gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no evidence at the apartment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing to indicate foul play, and we can’t charge him for his past crimes, not with his records missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have him at the motel. He attacked Ryan. He tied me up at gunpoint.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kidnapping. The aggravated assault of a police officer and use of a gun during a felony. That will work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we got him. That’ll buy us enough time to tie him to Amy Barrett, Susan Watts. Build a real case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We figured out how he might have crossed paths with Amy. Before she came to New York she was being treated for substance abuse at a nonprofit clinic in Ohio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t tell me. Kelly Nieman’s a donor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To that organization and dozens of others just like it across the country.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She and Tyson are in this together. Partners. A serial killer team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She must have recruited these women. Promised them a great job, a new look, and a bright future.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, a future that ended with Jerry Tyson. For all we know she and Tyson have been doing this for months. Years. He probably got smart, disposed of the bodies where we would never find them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Until Susan Watts got away. We’re going to bring him down. Nieman too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Has he said anything yet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not yet. But he’s about to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You should really soak up the ambiance. This is the nicest room you’re going to be seeing for quite a while.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: If you say so. You were at the apartment. First time I saw a cop who was a woman of your hotness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The first time? You don’t know me?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: No … I don’t know either one of you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, if you want to play that game. This is Richard Castle. I’m Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: How do you do, ma’am? Um … I’ve gotta be honest, this is a big misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why did you try to run?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: I don’t know. I’m sorry, I panicked, I guess. Honestly, I haven’t always been on the right side of the law.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t say. Tell us about Amy Barrett.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Oh, sweet girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was Amy doing at the apartment?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: She stays there with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is she, your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: I don’t want to put a label on what we have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is she now?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Um, I don’t know. It’s not like I keep tabs on her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Susan Watts? Is she your girlfriend, too?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: No. I don’t know her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Michael Boudreau?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why are you at his apartment, driving his truck?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Come on. Man, I’m Michael Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re Michael Boudreau?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Yeah. What? Yeah. Who else would I be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Oh. You – I get that from time to time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, that’s not surprising considering you look exactly like Tyson and nothing like this photo of Michael Boudreau. So why don’t you explain that?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Truth is, I got a little work done. You can still see a tiny scar here – – and here .

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got cosmetic surgery?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To look like a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: I never liked how I looked, and so I met this great surgeon and she just … gave me a new face. Funny thing is, I’ve never felt more like myself since I started looking like him.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: It’s weird, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was the surgeon Kelly Nieman?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Yes. Man, she is the best. She even did a little touchup on Amy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, the problem is, how are you going to prove that you are Michael Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: How do you prove I’m not?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective. An unexpected development. We only had one hard copy of Tyson’s fingerprints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, from the prison records, the ones I had them send here.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Right. But those prints don’t match the prints of the man we have in custody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, when you ran the prints, whose name came up?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Michael Boudreau. We checked and rechecked. There’s no mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know how he did it. Tyson killed Boudreau, took his identity. Kelly Nieman grafted Boudreau’s fingertips onto Tyson’s hands.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The scars would have shown up on his fingerprint card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kelly Nieman’s good enough not to leave scars.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Theories don’t help us, Mr. Castle. The DA just called. They heard from Boudreau’s lawyer, who says that we’re keeping his client under false pretenses.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a lie, sir. That man is Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then how do we prove it? Not with Tyson’s DNA sample, that’s missing. And as far as the DA is concerned, Tyson died when he went off the bridge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is why Tyson had his case files and all his records taken. For a clean slate, so he could kill and get away with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you saying that we have to release that man, sir?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Unless we can show that he’s Tyson or connect him to the murder? I’m afraid we have to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You have to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wish I was. Tyson’s getting moved to holding, but his next move might be outside of this precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless we can tie him to a crime or prove that he’s Tyson.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: After all this guy’s done. There’s gotta be something we can do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check the GPS on his truck. Let’s see where he’s been. And pull all the phone records from the apartment. We’ve gotta find something, anything, that’ll connect him to Susan Watts’ murder or Amy Barrett’s disappearance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How much time do we have before we have to cut him loose?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gates is trying to stall the DA, so we’ve got an hour, maybe two.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here we are, not being able to prove that Tyson is Tyson because we don’t have his DNA sample that he stole.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Unless this guy is Mike Boudreau. It could explain the fingerprints, all he’s been saying.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which would mean, what? That Tyson is actually dead and Kelly Nieman cut Boudreau to look like Tyson?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, this guy is Jerry Tyson. I’m going to talk to him. Rattle him. Get him to reveal himself.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I’m with Castle. I don’t think that man is Michael Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Based on what?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Once we ID’d Boudreau and Amy Barrett, I started monitoring their credit card activity. Boudreau’s card was just used to make a purchase at Café Julius in Midtown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Finding the real Michael Boudreau might give us just the break we need.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kind of a role reversal, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Not sure what you mean.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, sure you do. Wasn’t so long ago you were in here visiting me.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: You’ve got me confused with Tyson again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were dressed in a police uniform and I was in there where you are now.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: People think it’s killing that I like. But murder’s just an act. It’s all about the anticipation, the planning. Being inside your life. Knowing that I’m going to take it all away from you. That’s what I like.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What a feeling that must have been. That kind of power over someone. How does it feel now, Jerry?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Look, I get it. You think I’m Jerry Tyson and I guess I brought that on myself. But you are jaw-jacking with the wrong guy, okay? I’m Mike Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why the blondes? Amy Barrett, Susan Watts.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: I like blondes. But like I said, I don’t – I don’t know who this Susan Watts is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, I’m betting the reason goes back to what I said at the motel.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Oh, you really don’t know me at all, do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were raised by a single mother. She was blonde. Oh, she was beautiful, but … she never wanted you. You go into foster care, the bad kind. You have so much hate, so much hate towards your mother for abandoning you that you kill these women to get back at her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was I right? Is this all about mommy? It is about your mother. This is all about your mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Ryan. I got caught in traffic. Boudreau’s probably long gone by now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not necessarily. He ordered a Cobb salad at Café Julius so he may be in there eating.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll check. I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Amy Barrett? Wait, wait! I need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: AMY BARRETT
utterance.content: I need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Leave me alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, wait. We’ve been looking for you.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Yeah. Mike’s lawyer told me you’d show up. He said not to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you just use his credit card?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Mike gave me permission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The man that you know as Michael Boudreau is Jerry Tyson. He is a serial killer and you will be his next victim.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Back off!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s my card, Amy. Call me!

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Stay the hell away!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got it. I know how we can nail Tyson. The key is his mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about his mom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tyson’s birth certificate is missing, no surprise there. But his mother signed the papers when she dumped him into foster care. We compare her DNA to his, we can prove he’s Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And she’s still alive?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And living in White Plains. Her name is Gretchen Cutler.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gretchen Cutler?

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN CUTLER
utterance.content: Who wants to know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Detective Beckett, NYPD. This is Mr. Castle. We need to ask you a few questions about your son.

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: I don’t have a son.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re talking about Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: I know who you’re talking about. He hasn’t lived here since he was nine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When he was put into foster care.

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: I was a good mother. Nothing I ever did could have made him what he was. The stuff they said was not true.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, actually we believe that he was unjustly accused of several crimes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And we’re just looking to clear his name.

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: It’s a little late for that now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It might help you rest easy, knowing that some of what was said about Jerry’s untrue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All we would need is a sample of your DNA.

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: Well, that won’t do you no good. Jerry wasn’t my blood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re listed as his mother.

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: Not by choice. He was Jeff’s kid. He was a boyfriend at the time. Jeff took off and he never came back, so what was I going to do? I tried to make this a happy home for Jerry. I looked after him as long as I could, but … he was a hellion. He was born that way. Nothing I ever did could have made him what he was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, do you know where Jeff is now? Or Jerry’s biological mother?

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: Dead, both of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you still have any of his things? Like a toothbrush or a hairbrush?

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: Nothing like that. Jerry came by years ago and he made me hand over anything that was ever his.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you didn’t keep any of his belongings. Nothing at all?

utterance.speaker: GRETCHEN
utterance.content: Well, I couldn’t let it all go. I tucked away a few keepsakes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mind if I take a look?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His mom sounds like a real saint.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, agreed. The only people who keep insisting they’re not terrible parents are terrible parents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are all just toys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t think we can pull DNA from any of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but I mean, these were Jerry Tyson’s toys. They’re just so normal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’d you expect? Dead animals? Shrunken heads?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: … no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Baby tooth. His tooth. With his DNA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The lab is expediting DNA tests from the tooth. They’ll call you as soon as they have prelim results.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And what are they using as a comparative sample?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, saliva from a beer that Tyson was drinking when we busted him at the apartment.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then Tyson has no idea that we’re running his DNA?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh uh.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That’s excellent, Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, where are we on the DA?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I convinced him to stall Tyson’s lawyer until the results came in. And I’ll let you know when I hear something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Nieman.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. I told you the man in the photo wasn’t Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Waiting for Mike Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Interesting. And what is your relationship with him?

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: He’s a patient in need of support.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. You really go the extra mile.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: How soon until Mike is released?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not as soon as you were hoping.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tyson’s lawyers insisted we move him from the holding cell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kelly Nieman is here. She’s waiting for him to be released.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I look forward to her profound disappointment. You know, I remember back at the motel, when I saw him turn. When I knew who he was and he knew I knew. It all came to me a second too late. I’ve relived that moment so many times, knowing that my mistake set him free and cost people lives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were almost one of those people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And now I have a chance to help put the genie back in the bottle. Which is a terrible metaphor, because that guy is no genie. Who’d want three wishes from him, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Amy. Amy Barrett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amy? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: I saw her. I saw her on the news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who? Who did you see?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: The girl that died. That looked like me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Susan Watts? Amy, did you know her? Do you know anything about her?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Is that why you arrested Mike? Because you think he could have –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amy, did he ever say anything about her? Did he ever mention her name?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: No. But I saw them together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Three days ago. When Mike was driving the truck. She was with him. I thought he was cheating on me, but now … I’m afraid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you have every reason to be. But Amy, I can protect you. Where are you now?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Corner of 9th Ave and Jay Street.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move. I’ll be there, okay?

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll go with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. I don’t want to scare her off. She’s the only person that might be able to connect Susan Watts’ murder to Tyson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man, she’s got some brass ones, doesn’t she, showing up here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sit down, bro. Pacing’s not going to make the results come any quicker.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ve been reading how DNA results degrade over time. What if they can’t pull any from that tooth?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They can pull DNA from a caveman tooth. It’s not going to be a problem.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Still. We’re waiting. It’s killing me.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Hey. What brings you here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I just uh, thought you might like some company.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Sure, why not? Pull up a chair.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: What are we waiting for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, probably just paperwork.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You ever go out to White Plains?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Can’t say that I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was um … I was just out there. I saw your childhood home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I met Gretchen Cutler.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: I’m not familiar with that name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what she said? She said, nothing she ever did could have turned you into what you are. Is that true? Because I get the feeling it isn’t. I get the feeling she’s the first person you ever wanted to kill. But … that would be too obvious. Better to hunt blonde women who look like Gretchen once did. See, that way she’d have to see their faces on the news and know that you’re out there killing them because of you. Now you’ve taken it to the next level, haven’t you? I came across the photo of Gretchen Cutler when she was young. Susan Watts and Amy Barrett look just like her, thanks to Kelly Nieman. She supplied you with perfect, compliant victims. How many were there? Not just two. Five? Ten? Twenty? After all, you don’t have to hunt them anymore. You raise them. Like livestock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s you.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Yes, it is.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: If by ‘you’ you mean Mike Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, this is it, bro.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Boudreau.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Yes, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How is it possible?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The DNA from the tooth wasn’t a match.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s him. We know it’s him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ed Turner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The guy who supposedly found Susan Watts' body. Ed Turner. That name is an anagram for ‘returned’.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Maybe that’s a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. It’s not. There’s no coincidence with Tyson. He’s always one step ahead. He wanted to be here and so did she.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It keeps going to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: NIEMAN
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: It’s done.
